title: What is the importance of statistics and probability? - Quora

response.answer_text: Probability tells you that if you model a phenomenon by a probability distribution, you can make various predictions. Probability does not and cannot tell you what distribution to use as a model. The whole point of statistics is to guide you in choosing a model, generally by using some criterion of fit between the model predictions and observed outcomes.

Statistics and probability is the study and knowledge of seemingly unfortunate random events that happen to you, or uncertain decisions you have to make. In short, statistics and probability is the study of random events. By having a good understanding of statistics and probability, you can (1) decide somewhat correctly if you should perform that life-threatening surgery recommended by your doctor, (2) make better health decisions and eating habits, (3) not smoke, (4) finish your university degree, (5) backpack to seemingly “dangerous” foreign countries, (6) predict the weather next week, and (7) gamble better
